reviews.text: Three couples stayed from April 5th to 19th at this resort. Really enjoyed the resort overall and came back from this trip refreshed. Good staff and the entertainment was excellent with the water ballet night the highlight. The main hotel lobby bar had some great musicians to listen to before dinner. It was really nice having our Canadian money at par for the first time. Never had a problem finding something to eat and enjoyed the Italian and Seafood restaurants. There is a smiling lady in a small shed behind the main pool who makes the best home made donuts you would ever want and everyone should experience it. Lots of weddings on the beach during our stay and it looked from our perspective that the staff worked hard getting things ready. Lots of things to do around the resort and the boardwalk along the sea towards the flea market was nice for long walks. Only minor complaint I had was that some fellow tourists would run down early in the morning to put clothing on chairs located under shade and end up not using them for most of the day. This resort was packed solid during our trip and shade was at a premium on the beach. The staff overall spoke English very good and was the best we have ever experienced in Cuba in regards to language. Back in the fall of 2010 our group was thinking of changing resorts due to the very poor reviews showing on this web site. We are sure glad that we stayed with our original booking as we all had a great time. There is no question we would return if the price is right.
reviews.title: Great Relaxing Vacation

reviews.text: We stayed at Brisas Guardalavaca from April 16 - 23, 2011 and I traveled with my husband and two children (8 and 3 yrs).
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!

reviews.text: We stayed in the Villa section, which is the only section families should stay in really, since the hotel side is loud at night. Also a note in case you are wondering: the villa mini suites do have a bit of a separate area for kids to sleep, but you are ultimately all together in one room - there are NOT 2 separate bedrooms, which we wish we could have had.
reviews.title: Great Place, Great Value for your money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We weren't sure what to expect at this resort since we had never stayed in this part of Cuba, nor did we know anyone who had stayed here, so we were admittedly a bit wary - but we were pleasantly surprised! The resort is kept very clean, as are the rooms. The staff is very friendly, the food was better than expected (best I've had at any caribbean resort), and my kids ate everything which was great!
reviews.title: Perfect Wedding

reviews.text: We especially enjoyed the swim-up bar at the villa section, and the close proximity to the beach. There were always chairs available on the beach - but you should plan to get there in the morning if you want a spot in the shade, those spots go fast. The sand is white and beautiful, the water is clear and the kids just loved it.
reviews.title: Not bad for the price

reviews.text: Well,it's report card time for Brisas Guardalavaca in gorgeous Playa Guardalavaca.....Let's see how they stacked up,in our eyes......
reviews.title: Brisas Guardalavaca passes the test with flying colors,a great report card!

likes.liked: — The location,the cleanliness,and the friendly staff!And,of course the awesome room!
likes.disliked: — Dunno,hard to say,it was all really pretty good.....!

reviews.text: We were there from February 9-16th,2008,and housed in the Villa section,building number 6....
reviews.title: Nice Vacation, Terrible food

likes.liked: — interacting with people and good customer service

reviews.text: First of all,before I forget,I exchanged 100 Canadian dollars in the hotel lobby at the exchange place,and received 88.35 CUC,so not a bad rate,did slightly better in hotel than at the airport a couple of days before.....
reviews.title: Bring your own food

reviews.text: We travelled with Air Canada vacations,so on an Air Canada plane,which we'd booked with Selloffvacations.com. Have booked several trips with them,and never a problem.The Air Canada rep held our trip meeting in main hotel up by Italian restaurant,and the Air Canada book was available only in the hotel lobby,not in the Villa lobby.Most companies have them in both places (to refer to departure times,excursion info,and the like) but both Air Canada and Hola Sun books are located only in the main lobby...
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation at the Brisas

likes.liked: — The freindly atmosphere and the wonderful location
likes.disliked: — There isn't anything we didn't like

reviews.text: On our flight to Holguin,and being the first charter out of Halifax this winter,they messed up on the food.We were supposed to receive a snack but didn't,only a drink.By the return a week later,they knew it,and we did get our snack,and an apology for the omission the week before. Our flight from Halifax left ontime and arrived in Holguin a few minutes early.....On the plane,which had lots of leg room and each person had an individual TV screen,I chose to watch the 2007 movie with Ben Stiller ,the Heartbreak Kid,very appropriate for anyone headed to a sun destination as it takes place in Mexico.Excellent.
reviews.title: We Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here from May 1-May 8th, and after reading all the great reviews we went with a very positive outlook. I must say that I was somewhat let down. The people were not nearly as friendly as everybody raved about. The front desk was absolutely rude anytime we went to ask them a question. The waiters and waitresses in the buffet, for the most part, were not friendly at all and on numerous occasions we had to track them down to get drinks because they never came over to ask us if we wanted any. We would tip the bartenders and most of them wouldn't even say thank you. We did, however, have a few waiters and waitresses who went out of their way. We sat with the same lady every morning and she couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. We also had a romantic dinner on the beach, and Michel and Eugene were amazing.
reviews.title: Very nice vacation

reviews.text: We had some issues with our hotel room, we were ocean viewing on the 2nd (or 3rd, if you go by the numbers) floor, and we had an amazing view. The room was kept clean, but by the third day we had a really bad ant problem. The maids left me a birthday cake, as I celebrated my birthday while we were there, and by mid-day it was covered in ants so we had to throw it out. We had to go around killing ants for the rest of our stay. We never left our patio door open, but I noticed a few holes between the seals where the ants could get in. The water pressure and temperature was almost always good, but one day had no heat and the water would just spit out a few times and then stop over and over again. This was only one day though, so it wasn't a real problem. Our hairdryer usually would only work for a very short period of time and then shut off, and I would have to wait about 10 minutes before it would turn back on again. Our lock on our patio door also did not work. We never reported any of this to the front desk because I figured we were on vacation and I could very easily work around these problems, I didn't let them bother me.
reviews.title: Excellent holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was sufficient. I'm a very picky eater and could almost always find something to eat. It was bland, but not bad. There were even a couple evenings where I really enjoyed the food. There was more than enough selection to find something to suit your taste. We only ate at one a la carte restaurant, the Cuban one, and we really enjoyed it. We had breakfast here a couple mornings as well, which was really nice. The waitresses here were all very friendly, prompt, and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Rest and Relaxation

reviews.text: The grounds are kept in immaculate condition, and always clean. There are painters almost every day touching up the paint and keeping it clean. You always see somebody sweeping, mopping, wiping tables, cleaning up garbage, etc. There is never a moment that goes without somebody cleaning up.
reviews.title: A great place to relax & enjoy the sun & beach, excellent price, great people!

reviews.text: Unfortunately, the doughnut hut was not opened while we were there, as we never saw anybody in it. We did ask a worker and he told us it was open 9-5, but there was never anybody in it.
reviews.title: wonderful vacation both times!

reviews.text: My husband, my brother, my daughter and I stayed at Brisas in Guardalavaca from Jan. 10 to Jan. 24th. We had an exceptionally good vacation. There are pros and there are cons but we are going back next year and we have never returned to the same resort before.
reviews.title: Definitely going back

reviews.text: The cons were the flight, no coffee maker in the room, and moving rooms because we had requested twin beds and were given king size beds. Also there were 2 free excursions advertised on the Air Canada site which have now been cancelled indefinitely.
reviews.title: Tasheeta of Orangeville - you're so right!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The flight was from Vancouver to Toronto to Holguin. Living on Vancouver Island.....there is also the ferry to the mainland to be dealt with. The flight down was very tiring (we flew Air Canada) on a plane that only had 1 TV screen in around row 15 or so. We were in row 31 so there was virtually no chance of watching a movie. The trip back was gruelling. There was a 7 hour stopover in Toronto. This was from 12:00 midnight to 7:00 in the morning when nothing is open. We also had to claim our bags and tote them around the airport until 4:00 a.m. and then check in again. To make a long story short....we left Brisas Guardalavaca at 4:15 p.m. and did not arrive at our front door until 4:00 p.m. the next day. Next year we will fly from Comox (on the island) to Calgary and then straight down to Holguin.
reviews.title: Not the best region for a beach holiday

reviews.text: The absence of a coffee maker was known before we left but I just mention it so that anyone else will know ahead of time. We decided that next year we will take our own.
reviews.title: Who rates these resorts?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The request for twin beds went unnoticed........but, Rosie remedied that the next day. However, when you only have 14 days and, two of those are travel days, you don't want to spend even a single day moving.
reviews.title: Pure Paradise

reviews.text: I’m writing the review very late but needed to start adding my review as I travel a lot and have found the reviews here very helpful so here it goes.
reviews.title: Loved the Brisas Guardalavaca Villas

likes.liked: — We had the Villa and it was nice, big and clean

reviews.text: We went to Cuba to get married and we travelled with 34 friends and family. We were meant to stay in the Villas while family and friends stayed in the hotel. Due to building works in the hotel we where offered another hotel to stay in after our wedding (which is another review )
reviews.title: When all is said and done- just enjoy the fact that you are on vacation!
Who Needs a Five Star
reviews.text: The Brisas Guardalavaca is a lovely hotel, we where all upgraded to the Villas as the hotel was having building works. The Villas are spacious and well decorated we all enjoyed and loved the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff members were very friendly and where very helpful. The Beach which is 2 mins walk depending on where you are located within the hotel was lovely and clean, we got married at the hotel end of the beach as it was closed and no one was using this end of the beach  (we only got two nosey people in our wedding pictures)
reviews.title: The Brisas is A Cuban 4

likes.disliked: — The rooms are dated and in need of an update

reviews.text: All the restaurants within the hotel cooked ok food but it was nothing to write home about.
reviews.title: Another Great Vacation at Brisas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Brisas Guardalavaca from Jan.16th to Jan. 23rd. We travelled to Cuba with my sister and brother-in-law. After reading some of the reviews before we left we weren't sure what to expect. The reviews varied so much that it made me wonder what resort all the complainers were staying at compared to the majority of the vacationers. I'm not sure what some people expect when they travel to a third world country. The service was great when we arrived to the hotel after the bus ride from the airport. After we checked in and we went up to the room and unpacked. The room was very clean and more than adequate for the amount of time we stayed in it. I found the beds quite comfortable. The shower was a little hit and miss in our room but other than that it was fine. The bath towels weren't the biggest but there was enough small ones. The room was kept clean by the maid and towel art was left everyday by her. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. We got to know a few of them quite well. We found the food to be quite good and a large selection made it fairly easy to always find something good to eat. If all else failed there was the snack bar where you could get burgers, hotdogs, fries and pizza. We went to both a-la-carte and enjoyed them both. We went on the horse and buggy ride through Guardalavaca and it was an eye opening experience. We had the driver stop once so we could give a little girl walking along the road with her mother, a colouring book and crayons along with some gum. They were very appreciative of this gesture. We enjoyed the market and purchased a few hand made items to bring back home. I also went on the hobey cat with my sister and we had a blast. I had the oppurtunity to play lots of beach volleyball and got to meet lots of interesting people from all over the world. I especially enjoyed playing with and against Patrick who was from Quebec. We enjoyed our stay so much we are planning a return trip back to the Brisas with our daughters next year.
reviews.title: The Awesome Brisas

reviews.text: No customer service at all, do not please there customers.
reviews.title: Do not recommend this resort

reviews.text: We weren't respected as we stayed at the resort at all. The food was horrible and everyone we talked to had the same opinion. It was heated up over and over every night. we basically ate the same thing every night. There was no fresh fruit what so ever. The hotel room was infested with bugs. I would not recommend this for families with children. We had a ocean view room and it was noisy all night long. We had no big towels for after you shower. We asked for them and they said they didn't have any. The entertainment was terrible, they only had it a few nights, and if they had it it was repeated, same thing over and over. The beach was amazing, but part of the trip. The 24 hour grill, had run out of French fries on the 5th day of our trip, until the end. The water in the hotel and bar wasnt good to drink. My daughter asked for a glass of water and it was brown. I couldn't have tea overall in the hotel because the man said he couldn't make it because the water filters were broken. The day we were leaving there was water damage from the first floor to the main floor. Overall , we were treated like third world citizens. This wasn't a vacation i would want to remember and i don't recommend going to this resort.
reviews.title: Cuba, lovely Cuba

likes.disliked: — It was the same every day. By the end of the week, I was ready for something different.

reviews.text: Traveled to this location as a single female, mid-30's. Overall I really enjoyed it. I am the kind of person that goes out and makes my own fun. I met lots of other singles, groups, families, couples, etc. I did some things on my own as well as with the people I had met.
reviews.title: Again - a wonderful time...

likes.disliked: — The bed was a bit firm but not unbearable - no complaints really.

reviews.text: The only thing I was dissapointed about was the scuba. Although when I finally got to go, it was great, I only got to go once because of previous bookings and issues with the weather that made the diving unavailable to me until my last day. Lesson learned: In an all-inclusive scenario, see if you can book the scuba in advance to ensure that you get to go.
reviews.title: Tips and Ideas!

likes.disliked: — Food was not good. Smell of sewage sometimes.

reviews.text: We are first time travellers to Cuba. We arrived in Holgiun at 9:00 pm and a bus was waiting to take us to the resort. It was about an hour to the resort. Even though it was dark, you could see inside Cuban homes and get a glimpse of life in the country. (On the drive home you get get a full view of the country side.) We stayed in the Villa section based on trip advisor reviews. Check in was a breeze-they even had a table of beverages and small snacks waiting.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort which exceeded our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the third floor of Villa 4 which is at the far end of the resort complex. We had two rooms booked. The room decor is simple, the rooms were huge with vaulted ceilings and a balcony in both. Both our rooms were very clean and beds and pillows were very comfortable.
reviews.title: amazing value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the daylight we were amazed at how beautiful the grounds were. Tropical paradise! We were amazed by the landscaping, gardens, and statues every where you walk. Everything was spotless from the gardens to the beach. No matter where you stay at the resort, the beach is only steps away from your door.
reviews.title: Value for your money but some tradeoffs

reviews.text: The ocean is pristine. You can snorkel from one end of the resort to the other. The water activities centre is at the hotel section beside the pier to sign out the equipment We would strongly recommend the glass bottom boat excusion for $20 pesos/adult. It is about two hours and the guide dives under the boat to show all the wonders of the ocean. Very interactive excusrion that you will never forget.
reviews.title: "Excellent week"

reviews.text: The food was fabulous! I travelled with fussy eaters and we never had any issues or complaints. There was ample selection at every meal. Everything was fresh. They had stations for omlettes, crepes, pasta, fresh seafood depending on the time of day. The pork was the best I have ever had. The Hotel Buffet is the main spot for sit down meals with the largest selection of food at the resort. The Villa buffet is quieter but tended to have more seafood options. There is an ocean front all day a la cart in the Villa section-I recommend having at least one quiet breakfast while you visit, the view is beautiful. We sipped on cappucinos which are available all over the resort. The bar tenders served up up the most incredible selection of cocktails-we never felt the drinks were watered down.
reviews.title: Beyond our expectations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before getting married, i scrolled through pages of Tripadvisor trying to find out about weddings at this Hotel. So i thought i would write this... I have just came back from what was the most special day of my life.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC SPECIAL WEDDING AND HOLIDAY - top marks for brisas

reviews.text: The hotel and resort is absolute Paradise, clean pool areas, white sandy beaches, Hammocks, FREE watersports included, Maid service was Brilliant. Plenty of food to choose from but still there is that "all inclusive buffet dodgyness" no matter where you stay. The staff keep the place ever so clean and tidy but obviously they cannot stop the flies. Everyday I seen a man in the pool, scrubbing the sides of the pool and the taps and shower heads of the outsides showers with disinfectant. (good sign) Clean towels and linen EVERYDAY, The most pleasant staff i have ever came across in a hotel.
reviews.title: GO IF YOU LIKE BENIDORM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a few restaurants in the resort, which you have to book at reception, there is also evening entertainment around the pool which wasnt upto much .. but who cares - youre in Paradise!! The Nightclub is open from 11pm till 2am, which we found rather good after a few drinks.
reviews.title: Great Holiday - Poor Resort.

reviews.text: As for the wedding, we met with the wedding planner on our day of arrival, who talked us through EVERYTHING, she is really fluent in english and asks what colour bouquet you prefer and if you want added extras. We got married at 4pm, The groom goes 10 minutes before the bride and waits at the Gazebo which is beautifully decorated, the scenery is just fantastic, we also paid .. i think it was something like 25 pesos for the horse and cart.. all beautifully decorated, which took me from the hotel reception to the Gazebo. Some little Cuban men were providing the music with their guitars. The service lasts approx 10 minutes and the photographer and camera man do their photos and DVD throughout. I paid extra (12 pesos per person) to have our meal for ourselves and our guests on the beach and we could not fault it whatsoever ... the waiter worked so hard, backwards and forwards to the kitchens, nothing was a problem to him, he was so pleasant and happy, The table was laid lovely.. we got lots of photos. we had 5 courses .. the cake was beautiful..looked nice and tasted nice. Champagne kept arriving.. bottle after bottle. If you want a stress free, cheap wedding but want to be treat like royalty - come here. If any Brides out there ( or grooms) need to ask anything .. please get in touch. I know how it feels to be a Bridezilla :-)
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday shame about the food

reviews.text: Also, if you are getting married, you get your room decorated for the wedding night, breakfast in bed and on your last day of the holiday you get to keep your room until you leave. The bouquet of flowers is only provided for the Bride. I had 2 bridesmaids and i took over some artificial posys for them to carry, which im glad i did.
reviews.title: Simply amazing!
